API - PoundPay Client Library¶

class poundpay.Client(developer_sid, auth_token, api_url='https://api.poundpay.com', api_version='silver', opener_handlers=None)¶

Client is a thread-local object that is instantiated as a class variable of Resource, particularly when configure() is used.

Instantiating Client is as simple as passing in your developer’s developer_sid and auth_token.

The opener_handlers parameter should be an iterable to allow for custom handlers to pass into urllib2.build_opener().

delete(path, headers=None)¶

Issue a DELETE /path/resource-sid.

Parameters:
  • path – The resource location + the resource’s sid
  • headers – Optional parameter that should be a dictionary and will be passed on the urllib2.Request object
Return type:

A ClientResponse.

 
client = Client('YOUR_DEVELOPER_SID', 'YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN')
client_response = client.delete('/silver/payments/PY...')
assert client_response.response.getcode() == 204
assert client_response.json == {}
get(path, headers=None, **params)¶

Issue a GET /path/. If the /path/ has a resource-sid associated with it, this will return the representation of the resource located at /path/ that has that associated resource-sid.

Parameters:
  • path – The resource location
  • headers – Optional parameter that should be a dictionary and will be passed on the urllib2.Request object
  • params – Optional parameters to urllib.urlencode and append to path prefixed with a ‘?’.
Return type:

A ClientResponse.

 
# issue an index on all our payments
client = Client('YOUR_DEVELOPER_SID', 'YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN')
client_response = client.get('/silver/payments/')
assert client_response.response.getcode() == 200
# gives us back a paginated response
payload = client_response.json
assert 'num_pages' in payload
assert 'page_size' in payload
assert 'payments' in payload   # will be the resource name

# show a resource with resource-sid PY...
client_response = client.get('/silver/payments/PY...')
assert client_response.response.getcode() == 200
assert isinstance(client_response.json, dict)
assert client_response.json['sid'] == 'PY...'
post(path, params, headers=None)¶

Issue a POST /path/.

Parameters:
  • path – The resource location
  • params – The parameters to create the resource with.
  • headers – Optional parameter that should be a dictionary and will be passed on the urllib2.Request object
Return type:

A ClientResponse.

 
client = Client('YOUR_DEVELOPER_SID', 'YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN')
data = {
   'amount': 4000,
   'payer_email_address': 'x@y.org',
   'recipient_email_address': 'bl@x.com',
   'payer_fee_amount': 100,
   'recipient_fee_amount': 0,
}
client_response = client.post('/silver/payments', data)
assert client_response.response.getcode() == 201
assert isinstance(client_response.json, dict)
for key, value in data.iteritems():
    assert client_response.json[key] == value
put(path, params, headers=None)¶

Issue a PUT /path/resource-sid.

Parameters:
  • path – The resource location + the resource’s sid
  • params – The parameters to update the resource with.
  • headers – Optional parameter that should be a dictionary and will be passed on the urllib2.Request object
Return type:

A ClientResponse.

 
client = Client('YOUR_DEVELOPER_SID', 'YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN')
data = {'status': 'CANCELED'}
client_response = client.put('/silver/payments/PY...', data)
assert client_response.response.getcode() == 201
assert isinstance(client_response.json, dict)
assert client_response.json['status'] == 'CANCELED'
class poundpay.ClientResponse(file_like_object, data)¶

The response returned from any Client HTTP method. ClientResponse has a response instance variable, representing the file-like object returned by urllib2.urlopen and a data instance variable, representing the raw data read() from the response.

Sample usage:

response = urllib2.urlopen('http://google.com')
client_response = ClientResponse(response, response.read())

# access the internal response object for its API
assert client_response.response.getcode() == 200
assert client_response.response.geturl() == 'http://google.com'

# access the internal data object for the read contents.
assert 'html' in client_response.data.lower()
json¶

A property which decodes a JSON payload. Equivalent to:

return json.loads(self.data)
class poundpay.Developer(**kwargs)¶

The Developer resource, represented by a RESTful resource located at /developers.

classmethod all(**params)¶

Represents an index of a resource by issuing a GET /resource/

Parameters:params –

Optional parameters to urllib.urlencode and append to /resource/ prefixed with a ‘?’.
Return type:A list of Resource descendants, represented by cls.

Sample Usage:

import poundpay
poundpay.configure('DEVELOPER_SID', 'AUTH_TOKEN')

# paginated fetch of all associated payments
# equivalent of GET /silver/payments/
poundpay.Payment.all()

# fetch by offset and give me 5 results
# equivalent of GET /silver/payments/?offset=10&limit=5
poundpay.Payment.all(offset=10, limit=5)
delete()¶

Issues a DELETE on a resource.

Return type:None

Sample Usage:

import poundpay
poundpay.configure('DEVELOPER_SID', 'AUTH_TOKEN')
payment = poundpay.Payment.find('PY...')
payment.delete()   # issues a DELETE /silver/payments/PY...
payment = poundpay.Payment.find('PY...')
assert payment.response.getcode() == 404

Parameters:

  • params –

    Optional parameters to urllib.urlencode and append to /resource/sid prefixed with a ‘?’.
Return type:

A Resource descendant, represented by cls.

# paginated fetch of all associated payments
# equivalent of GET /silver/payments/PY...

classmethod find_me()¶

Issue a GET /developers/<developer_sid>

developer = poundpay.Developer.find_me()
assert developer.sid == 'YOUR_DEVELOPER_SID'
developer.callback_url = 'http://marketplace.com/callback/'
developer.save()
developer = poundpay.Developer.find_me()
assert developer.callback_url == 'http://marketplace.com/callback/'
save()¶

Issues either a POST or a PUT on a resource depending if has a sid or an id.

Return type:A Resource descendant, represented by cls.

Sample Usage:

import poundpay
poundpay.configure('DEVELOPER_SID', 'AUTH_TOKEN')

# paginated fetch of all associated payments
# equivalent of GET /silver/payments/
data = {
   'amount': 4000,
   'payer_email_address': 'x@y.org',
   'recipient_email_address': 'bl@x.com',
   'payer_fee_amount': 100,
   'recipient_fee_amount': 0,
}
payment = poundpay.Payment(**data)
payment.save()   # issues POST /silver/payments
assert payment.sid.startswith('PY')
payment.status = 'CANCELED'
# because payment already has a sid
payment.save()   # issues PUT /silver/payments
class poundpay.Resource(**kwargs)¶

Class that represents a RESTful resource at a particular endpoint. Has a class variable, Client, that is defaulted to None. Once configured, there are standard operators that are enabled on any resource.

cancel()¶

Cancels an ESCROWED payment by refunding the payer. All PoundPay fees are refunded back to the developer, as well.

Note

a PaymentCancelError is thrown if the Payment’s status is not ESCROWED

delete()¶

Issues a DELETE on a resource.

Return type:None

Sample Usage:

import poundpay
poundpay.configure('DEVELOPER_SID', 'AUTH_TOKEN')
payment = poundpay.Payment.find('PY...')
payment.delete()   # issues a DELETE /silver/payments/PY...
payment = poundpay.Payment.find('PY...')
assert payment.response.getcode() == 404
escrow()¶

Escrows an AUTHORIZED payment by charging the authorized payment method associated with the AUTHORIZED payment

Note

a PaymentEscrowError is thrown if the Payment’s status is not AUTHORIZED

release()¶

Releases an ESCROWED payment by paying out the funds to a PoundPay account.

Note

a PaymentReleaseError is thrown if the Payment’s status is not ESCROWED

versions()¶

Retrieves the list of past versions of the payment.

Each item in the list is itself a Payment object.

poundpay.configure(developer_sid, auth_token, api_url=None, api_version=None)¶

Configure a static client object.

Parameters:
  • developer_sid – Your developer sid
  • auth_token – Your designated authentication token (keep this secret)
  • api_url – The API URL to hit. Defaults to Client.API_URL when client is configured.
  • api_version – The API Version. Defaults to Client.API_VERSION when client is configured.
 
import poundpay
poundpay.configure('YOUR_DEVELOPER_SID', 'YOUR_AUTH_TOKEN')

developer = poundpay.Developer.find_me()
assert developer.sid == 'YOUR_DEVELOPER_SID'

Payment Exceptions¶

class poundpay.payments.PaymentEscrowError¶

Thrown when an error occurs while attempting to ESCROW a payment

class poundpay.payments.PaymentReleaseError¶

Thrown when an error occurs while attempting to RELEASE a payment

class poundpay.payments.PaymentCancelError¶

Thrown when an error occurs while attempting to CANCEL a payment
